gui

Class MainGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.MainGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GUICommons

    public class MainGUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements GUICommons
    This class will setup and organize all the sub GUI's into a main, full-sized, window.
    Author:
    manu

    • Method Detail

      • closeApplication

        public static void closeApplication()
        Call this method to close the window and exit the system should be called when the users have selected an action to quit the game.

      • displayWinnerAndLoser

        public static void displayWinnerAndLoser(java.lang.String wnlException_toString)
        Call this method to display a alert that will name the winner and the loser, AND prompt the user if they wish to play an other round.
        Parameters:
        wnlException_toString -

      • initMainWindow

        public static void initMainWindow(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.control.Button>> toBoard,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> toPlayerStats,
                                  int roundCount,
                                  int turnCount,
                                  boolean toIsPVE)
        Once the controller has initialized the game it should call this method with all the necessary parameters to display the game information
        Parameters:
        toBoard - a 2D ArrayList of type Button that represents each square on the board
        toPlayerStats - an Arraylist of strings that contain the game stats of each player including their username, info will apear in the order they are set in the ArrayList
        roundCount - of type int represents the current round count of a session
        turnCount - of type int represents the current turn count of a game

      • resetBoard

        public static void resetBoard(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.control.Button>> toBoard)
        The controller may call this method to reset the board with a new 2D ArrayList of Buttons. The changes will automatically be updated in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        toBoard - is a 2D ArrayList of type

      • updateBoardSquareButton

        public static void updateBoardSquareButton(int x,
                                           int y,
                                           char pieceColour)
        Call this method to update the button that represents a square on the board game. This method is to be called once a move has been succesfully played. It will update the square at the given x and y coordinates and set the appropriate piece colour on the button.
        Parameters:
        x - is the row position of the square to be updated.
        y - is the column position of the square to be updated.
        pieceColour - is the colour of the piece to have displayed on the square that is represented by 'w' for white or 'b' for black anything else will cause errors.

      • updatePlayerStatsPanel

        public static void updatePlayerStatsPanel(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> toPlayerStats)
        The controller may call this method to updatePlayerStatsPanel, by passing in a new set of playerstats in an ArrayList of type . Each item represents a new line on the player stats panel. Each string should contain a colon to seperate the label and the value.
        Parameters:
        toPlayerStats - an ArrayList of type , Each item represents a new line, and each string should contain a colon to seperate the label from the value.

      • updateRoundCount

        public static void updateRoundCount(int toRoundCount)
        The controller may call this method to update the roundCount value displayed on the GUI. Changes to the value will automatically display on the GUI in this method. To updateRoundCount and reset turncount, call the method updateRoundCount_ResetTurnCount().
        Parameters:
        toRoundCount - is an variable of type int that represents the number of rounds played by the same two players.

      • updateRoundCount_ResetTurnCount

        public static void updateRoundCount_ResetTurnCount(int toRoundCount)
        The controller may call this method to update round count and reset turn count in one method call. After updating the round count to the value passed in to the argument, turn count will default to 0.
        Parameters:
        toRoundCount -

      • updateTurnCount

        public static void updateTurnCount(int toTurnCount)
        The controller may call this method to update the turnCount value displayed on the GUI. Changes to the value will automatically display on the GUI by calling this method.
        Parameters:
        toTurnCount - is a variable of type int that represents the number of turns played in a single round.

      • getBoardButtonEventHandler

        public static javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> getBoardButtonEventHandler(int x,
                                                                                             int y)
        Call this method to setup the event handler for the button at the specified position of the board variable. When a user clicks an enabled button (square on the board) the controller will be notified to play the move. The value returned by the controller should be a char that represent the 'w' for white, or 'b' for black. this value is appeneded to the css style class name for the button that will determine if a white piece or black piece is played. In the event that the GameOver exception is thrown, this will be caught and signal the alert to notify the user who won and ask if they wish to play again; by calling the method getNewRoundConfirmationAlert();
        Parameters:
        x - of type int represents the row position of board variable
        y - of type int represents the column position of the board variable
        Returns:
        a new event handler for the button at the specified position on the board
